snippet: In an interview Sunday, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia veered between veiled threats and demands that the Ukraine government negotiate directly with separatists.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin addresses Ukraine in televised interview from Moscow, veering between veiled threats and demands for direct negotiations with pro-Russian separatists to resolve conflict in Eastern Ukraine.

byline.original: By ANDREW ROTH and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Andrew Roth reported from Moscow, and Andrew E. Kramer from Mariupol, Ukraine. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: In an interview Sunday, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia veered between veiled threats and demands that the Ukraine government negotiate directly with separatists.

headline.main: Putin Urges ‘Statehood’ Talks for Eastern Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Putin Urges ‘Statehood’ Talks for Eastern Ukraine
